definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: A swap designed to transfer the credit exposure of fixed ine products between parties.
sentences.chinese: 将固定收入产品的信用在双方间转移的互换。

sentences.english: Occupationbis more formal and is used additionally of work which may not provide a regular income.
sentences.chinese: 一词较文，还可指不一定有固定收入的工作。

sentences.english: But in addition to these extraordinary levies there were many permanent sources of revenue for the support of the Papal Court.
sentences.chinese: 除了这些特别税外，教廷还有许多固定收入的保障。

sentences.english: These price increases boe most severely on people with fixed incomes.
sentences.chinese: 物价的上涨对固定收入的人影响最历害。

sentences.english: So let's assume for starters that you still need regular income.
sentences.chinese: 假设你是一个需要固定收入的人。

sentences.english: As a retiree with a fixed income, I can only donate to our local community.
sentences.chinese: 我是靠固定收入的退休者，只能为我的社区乐捐。

definition: to deposit money (in a bank etc)/bank savings/bank deposit
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
